abstract: Amazon opens Amazon Go, grocery store that allows customers to select items and leave without waiting in line to pay for them; says smartphone app and other technology automatically tallies and processes purchases so no cashiers are needed; prototype is currently open only to Amazon employees in Seattle but is expected to eventually be rolled out to public.
lead_paragraph: At an experimental store on the ground floor of a new Amazon office building in Seattle, shoppers will be able to pluck what they want off the shelves and leave without waiting to pay.
snippet: At an experimental store on the ground floor of a new Amazon office building in Seattle, shoppers will be able to pluck what they want off the shelves and leave without waiting to pay....

headline.main: Amazon Moves to Cut Checkout Line, Promoting a Grab-and-Go Experience
headline.print_headline: Amazon Cuts Checkout Line at New Grab-and-Go Store
